subject: Re: Discussion on protection
author: rosemary_guiley
full_text:
I agree about people who are full of fear.  I see this all the time in
people who come to haunted weekends and investigations.  Usually the
ones who are overcome, or who go home with attachments, came with a
lot of built-in fear about the paranormal in general.  These people
should not be investigating, and definitely should not be seeking
communication interfaces.

Best
Rosemary

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Rosemary,
> 
> I think it is good to try and "disconnect" from the physical world 
> through meditation, as that is where we will hear direction within.  
> For me, it comes as thoughts...a "knowing."  This is how I hear those 
> who are speaking to me as to direction regarding my work.  They have 
> been doing so for a long time, so I have no fear of where I am 
> heading - even with this.  I realize it is different for each 
> individual.
> 
> Personally, I think if someone is full of fear, they shouldn't be 
> investigating ghosts, etc. Find what keeps you out of fear and roll 
> with it...
> 
> LC
> http://www.AngelsGhosts.com
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "rosemary_guiley" <reguiley@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > I think it's good to air diverse opinions on whether or not 
> protection
> > measures are advisable.  I agree that it's a matter of personal
> > preference, and I think researchers need to experiment to find their
> > own optimum comfort/performance levels.  What works for some will 
> not
> > for others.  
> > 
> > Personally, I find that an overall, daily approach of
> > prayer/meditation concerning all of my personal and professional
> > endeavors is the most effective for me.  I don't do it to keep 
> things
> > out, but to try to stay oriented on the most positive track.  Words,
> > thoughts and objects have all been demonstrated universally to be
> > tools of spiritual power.  Why not use them if it feels appropriate?
> > 
> > One of the best things we can do is share "here's what works for me"
> > and let others try it to see for themselves.
> > 
> > Thanks, everyone,
> > Rosemary
> >
